problem: How many multiples of $$4$$ are there from $$56$$ to $$92$$?     Below in Sam\textquotesingle s workings.  $56\div4 = 14$  There are $4$ multiples of $4$ from $1$ to $56$.  $92\div4 = 23$  There are $4$ multiples of $4$ from $1$ to $92$.  $23-14=9$  There are $9$ multiples of $4$ from $$56$$ to $$92$$.     Is Sam\textquotesingle s answers correct? If not, identify where he made his mistake and find the correct number of multiples.

problem: Think Academy has $32$ pencils and $40$ pens to give students as gifts. Each student should receive the same amount of pencils and pens, leaving no spare pens or pencils left. How many students at most will be able to receive the gift?
